is a town in the county of

. It is located on the island of Stord in the municipality of the same name (which only covers the southern half of the island). Confusingly, Stord municipality as a whole has town status, but Leirvik is the only town-like settlement in the municipality. Leirvik had a population of about 11,342 in 2008. It is the second largest town in Hordaland county.
, follow European route E39 south through

. Take the ferry from Os to Stord (Fitjar municipality). From the ferry terminus, continue following the road south until you reach Leirvik, about 28 km to the south.

From

, drive north on FV 47 then continue on E39.

From
, drive to Bergen, then follow the instructions above.
Stord Airport, Sørstokken is located not too far from Leirvik, and has flights to Oslo and

. Alternatively, Bergen Airport, Flesland and Stavanger Airport, Sola are both within a 2.5 hour drive. Haugesund Airport, Karmøy is even closer, and has scheduled flights to London-Stansted (Ryanair), Bremen (Ryanair), Bergen (SAS), Oslo (SAS) and Gdansk (Centralwings), as well as a few charter flights.

content=A nature reserve near Leirvik with a 2 km long hiking path. The area has many cultural and historic monuments, including a cholera graveyard from the 19th century and burial mounds from the Bronze Age. Bathing possibilities.
hours=Tue-Sat 18:00-24:00. Kitchen closes at 22:00. Closed Mon and Sun
content=A restaurant in an old, restored prison building in the center of Leirvik. Building also contains a wine cellar.

There are lots of hiking possibilities on Stord and elsewhere in the region. Contact Bergen Hiking Association for more information. A map of the hiking paths on Stord can be bought in the book stores on the island.
